physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Single intrauterine gestational sac containing a normal fetus with a normal heart rate. Area of nuchal translucency 3.7 mm in diameter (normal, â‰¤2.5 mm). Two cysts within the left ovary; a clear cyst, 4.1 cm, and a second cyst consistent with an endometrioma, 4.5 cm.
Follow-up ultrasound demonstrated a regular fetal heartbeat and fluid within the fetal stomach. The cranium and spine appeared well-formed for gestational age. There were bilateral nuchal hygromas.
Maternal karyotype revealed a reciprocal balanced translocation (46,XX,t(1;18)(q42.1;p11.2)). Fetal karyotype indicated an unbalanced translocation (46,XY,der(18)t(1;18)(q42.1;p11.2)mat).
Termination of the pregnancy was performed at 18 weeks due to the serious prognosis associated with the unbalanced translocation.
Delivered a healthy baby boy by cesarean section due to failed induction and nonreassuring fetal heart rate.
